channel.title: Refurbished Macbooks
channel.description:
I'm looking to buy a MacBook pro but the refurbished ones on the apple site are still like $1k.
Does anyone know reliable stores (By reliable I mean stores that I could actually physically go to) that sell refurbished MacBooks for a lot cheaper than the Apple prices?

item.title: Refurbished Macbooks
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Macs tend to be generally better but personally I don’t like Macs I’m more into PCs :p.

Read full topic

item.title: Refurbished Macbooks
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Uh so much ignorance with the touch screens. You guys realize apple invented the double tap touch screen architecture, that’s now used by several different organizations pending lawsuits? As far as I understand it (whether it be apple that did it themselves, or some company apple picked up), they were the first to do it successfully, as many other companies tried and failed on the technology.

Read full topic

item.title: Refurbished Macbooks
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:22, topic:432660”]Anyone who argued about the superior OS in this thread is a complete moron.

@op: I recently bought myself a new macbook and managed to get it around $1,000 AUD (less for American currency) and scored a $100 gift card to use on the app store (for apps like msword etc). I’m not sure if the offer is world wide but in Australia, Apple discounts students who are buying macs for school or university. You could do some research around that kind of discount and it may even apply for refurbished macs.[/quote]I’m pretty sure it’s a global thing. It has to be recognised tertiary education though.

Read full topic

item.title: Refurbished Macbooks
item.dc:creator: @Phaze_One Fuscate
item.description:
@Phaze_One wrote:

Anyone who argued about the superior OS in this thread is a complete moron.

@op: I recently bought myself a new macbook and managed to get it around $1,000 AUD (less for American currency) and scored a $100 gift card to use on the app store (for apps like msword etc). I’m not sure if the offer is world wide but in Australia, Apple discounts students who are buying macs for school or university. You could do some research around that kind of discount and it may even apply for refurbished macs.

Read full topic

item.title: Refurbished Macbooks
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:12, topic:432660”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=535371.msg3914210#msg3914210 date=1329017038]
linux > mac > windows
[/quote]
lol… why the hell did you post this? he wants a macbook and you give him some irrelevant opinions lol[/quote]so not the mopar spirit!

but very well…

macs are high priced/over priced. I do not suggest getting refurbished ones either. From my own experience at least refurbished ones (ones I have had the “honor” of working on macs. Refurbished ones generally have batteries that are horrible. Therefore, I would not suggest using a refurbished one.

Read full topic
